channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-6529] nightly regression test failure in newly added junit test TriggerGeneralTest
item.description:
consistent nightly regression test failure in testTriggersInGeneral newly
added junit test. The error happens consistently in windows ibm16 and
ibm17 but not in linux ibm16 and ibm17.

summary of failures:
1) testTriggersInGeneral(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.lang.TriggerGeneralTest)junit.framework.ComparisonFailure: expected:<...,(3,3,'3'),(4,4,'4')[
2) testTriggersInGeneral(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.lang.TriggerGeneralTest)junit.framework.ComparisonFailure: expected:<...,(3,3,'3'),(4,4,'4')[
3) testDerby5866TriggerExecutionOrder(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.upgradeTests.Changes10_11)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Column value mismatch @ column 'Y', row 1:
item.environment: is failing on windows ibm16 and ibm17, is not failing on linux ibm16 and ibm17
item.summary: nightly regression test failure in newly added junit test TriggerGeneralTest

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

FAILURES!!!
Tests run: 18443, Failures: 3, Errors: 0

DERBY-6520 added this new junit test when this issue began occurring. Thanks
knut for catching I got the wrong number.
I think the test was actually added in DERBY-6520. Updating the link.

Looks like this test is also failing in oracle nightly regression runs against windows, for instance:
http://download.java.net/javadesktop/derby/request_5589080/javadb-task-3827730.html
attaching test.out from running just the TriggerGeneralTest on windows.

the problem seems to be the "expected" string built by the program at line 444. The code looks right
to me as it adds \n\n at the end of the expected string, and looking in test.out that is what the test string
has. But for some reason the "expected" string reported by the exception only has a single new line.
When I added \n\naaa to the end of the expected string it got 2 new lines and the added text as expected.

I assume this has something to do with window and unix using different line ending in their files, but not sure how this relates to this code. All the other \n's in this string seem to be fine, just this final trailing pair.

Might be related to the use of PrintStream.println() in the test. It uses the platform's line terminator, but only for the newline that it adds at the end of the string. It won't replace occurrences of inside the string. That means println("a b") will print the string "a b " on Windows, rather than "a b " or "a b ".
I think your analyses are correct, thanks, guys! Since I introduced this, I'll fix it

Commit 1583343 from Dag H. Wanvik in branch 'code/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1583343 ]

DERBY-6529 nightly regression test failure in newly added junit test TriggerGeneralTest

Patch to make the test work also on Windows (CR LF issue).
Committed patch derby-6529 to fix this issue.
bulk change to close all issues resolved but not closed and not changed since June 1, 2014.
